comments: Next term is 2^1884+1884+1, with 568 digits and is too large to include. - _Emeric Deutsch_, May 13 2006
links: K. S. Brown, The Sum of the Prime Factors of N (Part 2: Primes of the Form 2k-1 + k), Math Pages
maple: a:=proc(n) if isprime(2^n+n+1)=true then 2^n+n+1 else fi end: seq(a(n),n=0..1000); # _Emeric Deutsch_, May 13 2006
mathematica: {ta={{0}}, tb={{0}}};Do[g=n;s=2^n+n+1; If[PrimeQ[s], Print[n];ta=Append[ta, n]; tb=Append[tb, s]], {n, 1, 10000}];{ta, tb, g} (* _Labos Elemer_, Nov 19 2004 *)
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), May 02 2001
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 04 2007
